newScannedThrough: Deloitte State of AI in the Enterprise 2026 (8th edition, published Jan 2026)

newContent.title: Deloitte State of AI in the Enterprise 2026 Report

findings.finding: Only 21% of organizations report having mature governance models for autonomous agents, despite 73% planning agentic AI deployment within two years
84% of companies have NOT redesigned jobs around AI capabilities, despite 82% anticipating 10% of jobs fully automated within three years
Only 25% of organizations have deployed 40%+ of AI pilots into production; pilot-to-production timelines extend from 3 months to 18+ months
Companies broadened workforce AI access by 50% in one year—from <40% to ~60% of workers equipped with sanctioned AI tools
Only 30% of organizations are redesigning key processes around AI; 37% use AI superficially without changing underlying business processes
Only 34% of leaders are truly reimagining the business with AI; 25% report AI having transformative effect (doubled from prior year)
Worker enthusiasm varies: 13% highly enthusiastic, 55% open to exploration, 21% prefer avoiding use, 4% actively distrust AI

newContent.title: CrewAI 2026 State of Agentic AI Survey

findings.finding: 65% of enterprises already using AI agents; 81% have fully adopted or actively scaling agentic AI across teams
Organizations have automated 31% of workflows with agentic AI, expect to expand by additional 33% in 2026
OpenAI released GPT-5.3-Codex-Spark optimized for real-time coding at 1000+ tokens/sec via Cerebras partnership

newContent.title: OpenAI Scaling Social Science Research Tool

findings.finding: OpenAI announced tool to help researchers turn qualitative data into quantitative analysis

summary: Major new content: Deloitte's 8th annual State of AI in the Enterprise (3,235 respondents, 24 countries) provides critical cross-cutting data on enterprise AI maturity. KEY STRUCTURAL FINDINGS: (1) Severe governance gap—only 21% have mature agent governance despite 73% planning agentic deployment; (2) Organizational inertia—84% haven't redesigned jobs despite 82% expecting automation; (3) Pilot purgatory—only 25% have moved 40%+ pilots to production; (4) Process redesign lag—only 30% redesigning processes, 37% doing surface-level integration; (5) Workforce access expansion—50% increase in sanctioned AI tool access in one year. CrewAI survey adds agentic-specific data: 65% already using agents, 31% of workflows automated. This source was mislabeled as openai.com—it's actually Deloitte's enterprise survey.

sourceCorrection.note: The source URL was listed as openai.com but the 'State of Enterprise AI' is actually Deloitte's annual enterprise survey. Recommend updating source-registry.json to point to https://www.deloitte.com/global/en/issues/generative-ai/state-of-ai-in-enterprise.html
